meanings.definition: The genetic constitution of an individual organism.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study different genotypes to understand how genes affect traits.
meanings.sent2: Each person has unique genotypes that determine their inherited characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The genotypes of the fruit flies made them excellent candidates for genetic research.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of genetics, the various genotypes bloom like flowers of diversity.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful charts to explain the concept of genotypes to the students.

meanings.definition: The set of genes in our DNA which is responsible for a particular trait.
meanings.sent1: Genotypes play a crucial role in determining eye color and hair texture.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the genotypes of different species helps in conservation efforts.
meanings.sent3: The genotypes of the puppies explained why one had a curly tail and the other a straight one.
meanings.sent4: The genotypes of the plants whispered secrets of resilience and adaptability.
meanings.sent5: The detective analyzed the genotypes found at the crime scene to identify the suspect.
